title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: A walk of about three miles in length has been made round Birnam Hill to its summit, which commands a view of Dunkeld  and the valley of the Tay, second only to that from Craig-y-Barns, and in some respects superior.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: In the immediate neighbourhood is Birnam Hill, 1580 feet above the level of the sea, and Birnam Wood, so famous for its connection with the fate of Macbeth.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: ' It is pretty looking down, and Craigybarns and Birnam Hill are fine, but there is no loch, and the hills don't seem so majestic as ours.'

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Against the sky, opposite Dunkeld, rises the classic Birnam Hill.

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: On the left was Birnam Hill, a picturesqueeminence adorned with trees ; and on the right thebrown waters of the Tay rushed along swiftly beneathoverhanging woods.
